ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I continued to develop my reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills in Italian!
I further developed my ability to communicate complex ideas in Italian by strengthening my vocabulary and grammatical knowledge.
I feel like I greatly improved my Italian skills. This semester I felt extremely confident in my speaking skills and learnt a lot about Italian culture

Good way to further develop Italian post L3. Also a great way to get closer to one of the BEST departments at Yale. By the time you get to this level, you will have had a lot of the professors in the department and they are always willing to help you out.
Conversational skills in Italian
This class helped me develop my skills in Italian, especially in my writing.
Great progress in learning Italian
More Italian grammar

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Loved the readings, movies, and podcasts. 
Weaknesses: a little disorganized-- there could have been more communication at some points.

One of the strengths was the emphasis on exploring Italian media through film and tv. It was helped me pick up on the nuances in spoken Italian that arent conveyed in textbooks. I thinkit would have been easier to learn some of the grammatical concepts we learned from the textbook if we had a greater variety of exercises because sometimes the ones from the textbook focused more on drilling the concept was rather than how to integrate it into speech.
Great recap of previous grammar topics and lots of new interesting case studies of Italian culture. Great final essay assignment too

I love the yale model of languages this class is basically all strengths. The only kind of weakness is that, given the nature of the curriculum, L3 and L4 kind of re hash all the themes of L1 and L2. It was helpful for me because I took a year off from Italian, but if you go straight through and retained all of L1/2, it could be a bit slow. Not a fault of the profs though! Just the nature of these kinds of languages.
Not really any weaknesses!
I really enjoyed this course, I dont think anything needs changed

Do not have students present songs. This is a waste of time and kicks off the class with something that is easy to tune out and does not engage us in learning or using Italian. There should be more opportunities for us to converse in Italian during the class. There should be more instruction on grammar throughout the class. It often seemed like we only got serious about grammar the day before the test, frantically cramming everything in to try and remember it for the exam the next day.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I love the Italian department, and Italian really is such a great language to learn, especially if you have knowledge of other romance languages-- highly recommend continuing your Italian learning with L4! :)
Id recommend it if you want to learn more about Italian culture and further practice your conversation skills.
Absolutely- Anna is an incredible teacher and the course is fantastic
Yes! Of course. Go past L3 if you can! If nothing else, you will be able to get involved in a new, really cool department and community
Yea!
Yes
